siminsee 0.1.0
  • Reference

Package index

All functions

ana_mult_1gr()
We analyze with a Cox model the data contained in 'dat' to compare the 3 different estimation approaches with the estimation based on true data for each scenario and each repetition This function should be used when all patients are in the same group ('HR' in function trial should be equal to 1)
ana_mult_2gr()
We analyze with a Cox model the data contained in 'dta' to compare 2 groups (for example treatment)
graph_alpha_grp_tt2()
Graphic of alpha by PDV x lambda0 x HR_pdv panels and pinsee varying between groups for scenarios with HR = 1
graph_beta_grp_tt2()
Graphic of beta by PDV x lambda0 x HR_pdv panels and pinsee varying between groups
graph_biais_grp_tt2()
Graphic of mean absolute bias by lambda0 x PDV panels x HR_pdv and pinsee varying between groups
graph_bias_distr_tt2()
Graphic of boxplots absolute bias by lambda0 x PDV panels and pinsee varying
graph_HR1gr_tt2()
Graphic of HR by lambda0 x PDV x TACC/TFU panels and pinsee varying
graph_surv1gr()
Graphic of survival curves for scenarios with same TAC, TFU parameters for the 3 different approaches
mean_coeff_ana_2gr()
We calculate mean coefficients over repetitions for each scenario
nlisttrial()
We simulate different trials with possibly different parameters specified in arguments for each scenario
resu_dat_1gr()
We calculate the percentages of patients with events, lost to follow-up, excluded alive or immortal according to the estimation approach for each repetition of each scenario

Developed by Clémence Léguillette, Pierre-Yves Cren, Youenn Drouet.
